item.title: 华尔街券商开始报道 Reddit，对用户增长持怀疑态度
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P.Morgan）和摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）开始对 Reddit 进行评级，评级等同于 "持有"，因为他们在等待这家社交媒体公司用户增长情况的明朗化，同时继续看好广告收入增长和人工智能（AI）计划。【原文：J.P.Morgan and Morgan Stanley started coverage on Reddit with equivalent to "hold" ratings, as they wait for clarity on the social media company's user growth, while staying bullish on ad-revenue growth and artificial intelligence (AI) initiatives.】

item.title: 皮德蒙特锂公司获得北卡罗来纳州项目采矿许可
item.description: 矿商皮德蒙特锂业公司（Piedmont Lithium）表示，该公司已从北卡罗来纳州监管机构获得了拖延已久的锂矿开工许可，这将进一步促进美国电动汽车电池组件的供应。【原文：Miner Piedmont Lithium said that it had received a long-delayed permit for starting the construction its lithium mine from North Carolina regulators in a further boost to the supplies of the electric vehicle battery component in the United States.】

item.title: 高盛投资银行业务强劲，利润跃升 28
item.description: 高盛集团周一发布报告称，受承销和交易复苏提振，其投资银行部门第一季度利润增长 28%。【原文：Goldman Sachs' profit rose 28% in the first quarter, buoyed by a recovery in underwriting and dealmaking that boosted its investment banking unit, it reported on Monday.】

item.title: Meta 将暂时关闭土耳其社交媒体平台 Threads
item.description: Meta Platforms 周一表示，将从 4 月 29 日起暂时关闭其在土耳其的社交媒体平台 Threads，以遵守土耳其竞争管理机构的临时命令。【原文：Meta Platforms said on Monday it would temporarily shut down its social media platform Threads in Turkey from April 29 to comply with an interim order of the Turkish competition authority.】

item.title: 独家报道：英国石油公司电动汽车充电部门裁员，降低全球雄心
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP）的消息人士称，由于对商用电动汽车车队快速增长的押注没有得到回报，该公司已经裁减了超过十分之一的电动汽车充电业务员工，并将其撤出多个市场。【原文：BP has cut over a tenth of the workforce in its electric vehicle charging business and pulled it out of several markets after a bet on rapid growth in commercial EV fleets didn't pay off, company sources said.】

item.title: 复仇者联盟：终章复仇者联盟：终章》制片人将亚马逊高管纳入工作室团队
item.description: 复仇者联盟：终局之战》的联合导演乔-罗素（Joe Russo）找到了一个令人难忘的环境，来接触他与兄弟创立的独立制片厂的最新员工：复仇者联盟：终结者》（Avengers: Endgame）的联合导演乔-鲁索（Joe Russo）找到了一个令人难忘的环境，来为他与兄弟创立的独立制片厂招聘最新的员工。鲁索邀请亚马逊米高梅工作室的高管克里斯-布雷顿（Chris Brearton）和他一起参加在西班牙潘普洛纳举行的奔牛节。【原文：Joe Russo, co-director of "Avengers: Endgame," found a memorable setting to approach the latest hire for the independent studio he founded with his brother. Russo invited Chris Brearton, an executive at Amazon.com's MGM studio, to join him at the Running of the Bulls in Pamplona, Spain.】

item.title: 现在是在美国出售房屋的最佳时机
item.description: 如果您要在美国出售房屋，您可能会想知道何时将房屋投放市场才能获得最佳价格。【原文：If you are selling a home in the U.S., you may wonder when to put it on the market and get the best price.】

item.title: 联合健康遭黑客攻击，第一季度财报悬而未决
item.description: 分析师表示，UnitedHealth 的技术系统（包括管理处方和医疗索赔的系统）遭到网络攻击破坏后，预计其首份财报将录得更高的医疗成本。【原文：UnitedHealth is expected to record higher medical costs in its first earnings report since a cyberattack disrupted its technology systems including those that manage prescription and medical claims, analysts said.】

item.title: 宝洁公司涨价令购物者钱包缩水
item.description: 个人护理产品价格上涨可能会抑制美国人购买大品牌家用产品的习惯，从而对全球最大的包装商品制造商之一宝洁公司构成威胁。【原文：Rising prices of personal care products could quash Americans' habit of buying big-brand-name items for their household pantries, posing a threat to Procter & Gamble , one of the world's biggest makers of packaged goods.】

item.title: 早间竞价：伊朗/以色列紧张局势下的周末安全交易平仓
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 据 Electrek 报道，特斯拉将裁员 10%以上
item.description: 科技出版物 Electrek 周一援引一份内部备忘录报道称，特斯拉将裁员 10%以上。【原文：Tesla will lay off more than 10% of its workforce, tech publication Electrek reported on Monday, citing an internal memo.】

item.title: 中东问题受控，股市攀升，原油下跌
item.description: 本周伊始，欧洲主要股市和汇市小幅走高，而油价和债券价格则有所下跌，因为在伊朗周末袭击以色列之后，投资者对中东问题保持了担忧。【原文：Europe's main share and currency markets started the week modestly higher while oil and bond prices dipped, as investors kept Middle East concerns in check after Iran's weekend attacks on Israel.】

item.title: 中东局势动荡不安，期货价格从上一交易日的暴跌中反弹
item.description: 美国股指期货周一上涨，此前华尔街因美国几大银行上周令人失望的盈利状况而遭遇严重抛售，中东地区不断升级的紧张局势也令投资者心生警惕。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Monday, after Wall Street witnessed a bruising sell-off on the back of disappointing earnings from some big U.S. banks last week and escalating tensions in the Middle East made investors wary.】

item.title: 美国对3300多辆通用凯迪拉克Lyriq汽车制动辅助系统失灵展开调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周一表示，已开始对3300多辆通用凯迪拉克Lyriq汽车刹车辅助系统失灵的索赔进行初步评估调查。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Monday it has opened a preliminary evaluation to investigate claims of loss of brake assist on over 3,300 GM Cadillac Lyriq vehicles.】

item.title: 美国国税局称已实现美国报税季服务目标，但仍需资金支持
item.description: 周一是报税截止日，国税局在报税截止日一开始就宣布，它已超额完成了加快向纳税人提供帮助的目标，并将电话等待时间缩短至三分钟，同时强调国会有必要为税务机构保持足够的资金。【原文：The Internal Revenue Service started tax filing deadline day on Monday by announcing that it had exceeded its goals for speeding assistance to taxpayers and cutting phone hold times to three minutes, and underscoring the need for Congress to maintain adequate funding for the tax agency.】

item.title: 汉莎航空为获得欧盟点头同意收购 ITA 提供优惠条件
item.description: 欧盟委员会网站上的最新消息显示，德国汉莎航空公司已作出让步，以确保其收购意大利航空公司 ITA Airways 少数股权的交易获得欧盟的反垄断批准。【原文：German airline Lufthansa has offered concessions aimed at securing EU antitrust approval for its acquisition of a minority stake in Italian carrier ITA Airways, an update on the European Commission website shows.】

item.title: 美国将向三星德克萨斯芯片生产基地拨款 64 亿美元
item.description: 美国商务部周一表示，拜登政府将向韩国三星公司提供高达 64 亿美元的资助，以扩大其在得克萨斯州中部的芯片生产，这也是扩大美国芯片生产的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：The Biden administration will award up to $6.4 billion in grants to South Korea's Samsung to expand its chip production in central Texas as part of a broader effort to expand U.S. chipmaking, the Department of Commerce said on Monday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，特斯拉在印度物色首批展厅地点
item.description: 两位熟悉相关讨论的人士表示，美国电动汽车制造商特斯拉正在新德里和孟买考察潜在的展厅地点，计划今年晚些时候在印度开始销售。【原文：U.S. electric carmaker Tesla is looking at potential showroom locations in New Delhi and Mumbai ahead of plans to begin sales in India later this year, two people familiar with the discussions said.】

item.title: 中国第一季度 GDP 增长可能放缓，将采取更多刺激措施
item.description: 由于房地产长期低迷和私营部门信心疲软拖累了需求，预计中国经济在第一季度将有所放缓，政策制定者将继续面临推出更多刺激措施的压力。【原文：China's economy is expected to have slowed in the first quarter as a protracted property downturn and weak private-sector confidence weigh on demand, maintaining pressures on policymakers to unveil more stimulus measures.】

item.title: OpenAI 竞标日本业务，开设东京办事处
item.description: 微软支持的人工智能初创公司 OpenAI 周一在东京开设了首个亚洲办事处，并在日本开展业务。【原文：Microsoft backed artificial intelligence startup OpenAI made a pitch for business in Japan on Monday as it opened its first Asia office in Tokyo.】

item.title: 独家新闻俄罗斯和中国交易伪装成废铜的新铜，以规避税收和制裁
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士告诉路透社，俄罗斯铜业公司（RCC）和中国公司通过伪装成废料的新铜线杆交易避税并规避西方制裁的影响。【原文：Russian Copper Company (RCC) and Chinese firms have avoided taxes and skirted the impact of Western sanctions by trading in new copper wire rod disguised as scrap, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美元涨势因美国利率前景分歧而加剧
item.description: 美元正在加速反弹，因为顽固的通胀使人们对美联储今年能够比其他央行更积极地降低利率产生怀疑。【原文：A rally in the U.S. dollar is accelerating, as stubborn inflation sows doubts over how aggressively the Federal Reserve will be able to cut rates this year compared to other central banks.】

item.title: 美国经济增长可能给全球带来繁荣，但通胀可能使列车脱轨
item.description: 美国经济增长持续高于其潜力，正在成为全球经济持续扩张的关键支撑，但这个全球最大经济体的持续高通胀和紧缩货币政策所产生的溢出效应，可能会给人们所期望的全球 "软着陆 "带来新的风险。【原文：U.S. economic growth that keeps motoring above its potential is emerging as a key prop for an ongoing global expansion, but spillovers from persistently high inflation and tight monetary policy in the world's largest economy could pose new risks to a hoped-for "soft landing" around the world.】

item.title: 欧洲 紧张的市场等待以色列的回应和美联储的展望
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: IDC 称，由于 iPhone 出货量下降，苹果公司的手机制造商头把交椅被三星公司夺走
item.description: 研究公司IDC周日公布的数据显示，由于安卓智能手机制造商争夺市场份额的竞争加剧，苹果公司2024年第一季度的智能手机出货量下降了约10%。【原文：Apple's smartphone shipments dropped about 10% in the first quarter of 2024, hurt by intensifying competition by Android smartphone makers aiming for the top spot, data from research firm IDC showed on Sunday.】

item.title: 中国万科称面临短期流动性压力
item.description: 国有企业中国万科表示，该公司正面临短期流动性压力和经营困难，但补充说，该公司已准备了 "一揽子计划 "来稳定业务和削减债务。【原文：State-backed China Vanke said it is facing short-term liquidity pressure and operational difficulty, but added that it has prepared "a basket of plans" to stabilise its business and cut debt.】

item.title: 中国央行维持政策利率不变，从银行系统抽走现金
item.description: 中国央行周一在展期到期的中期贷款时，一如普遍预期维持关键政策利率不变，并通过债券工具从银行系统抽走了一些现金。【原文：China's central bank on Monday left a key policy interest rate unchanged as widely expected when rolling over maturing medium-term loans, and drained some cash from the banking system through the bond instrument.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击事件后油价下跌，市场降低风险溢价
item.description: 油价在周一的交易中下跌，原因是市场参与者在伊朗周六晚些时候袭击以色列后降低了风险溢价，以色列政府称这次袭击造成的损失有限。【原文：Oil prices fell during trade on Monday, as market participants dialled back risk premiums following Iran's attack on Israel late on Saturday which the Israeli government said caused limited damage.】

item.title: 日本机械订单大幅增长，可能缓解对国内需求的担忧
item.description: 日本 2 月份资本支出的主要指标创下一年来最大增幅，从上个月的下降幅度中大幅反弹，这是国内需求的一个可喜迹象，尽管当局担心日元走软及其对生活成本的影响。【原文：Japan's key gauge of capital spending jumped the most in a year in February, rebounding sharply from the prior month's decline in a welcome sign for domestic demand even as authorities worry about a weakening yen and its impact on the cost of living.】

item.title: 美国降息押注减弱，美元坚挺，日元下滑
item.description: 由于中东冲突升级和美国利率顽固高企的前景提供了支撑，美元周一企稳，保持了自2022年以来的最大单周涨幅。【原文：The dollar steadied on Monday, holding its biggest weekly gain since 2022, as escalating conflict in the Middle East and the prospect of stubbornly high U.S. interest rates gave support.】
